com.invectorate.open.queutures

Class QueutureTask<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.invectorate.open.queutures.QueutureTask<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - The type of object being generated by the computation.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Queuture<V>, RunnableQueuture<V>, Runnable

    public class QueutureTask<V>
extends Object
implements RunnableQueuture<V>
    An implementation of Queuture that additionally provides the ability to run a computation.

    A BlockingQueue is used to pass data between the computation and the consumers of this class. Any type of BlockingQueue is eligible to be used; interesting (but not unintentional) effects can be demonstrated by using, e.g., a SynchronousQueue.

    In addition to serving as a standalone class, this provides protected functionality that may be useful when creating customized task classes.

    Author:
    Noah Fontes , Doug Lea

    • Constructor Detail

      • QueutureTask

        public QueutureTask(Informable<QueutureBox<V>> informable,
            BlockingQueue<V> queue)
        Create a new QueutureTask that will execute the given Informable as its computation, passing results back to this class using the given BlockingQueue.

        The queue passed to this object is required to be empty (Collection.isEmpty()). Additionally, it must not be modified in any way outside of this class until isDone() returns true.

        Parameters:
        informable - The computation to execute.
        queue - The queue to use to pass results to this class.

      • next

        public V next()
       throws InterruptedException,
              ExecutionException
        Description copied from interface: Queuture
        Returns the next result of the asynchronous computation.

        If there are no more results to be returned, this method returns null. Subsequent calls to this method after computation is complete will always return null.

        This method will block until the next result is available, possibly indefinitely.

        Specified by:
        next in interface Queuture<V>
        Returns:
        The next result of the asynchronous computation, or null if there are no more results.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the current thread is interrupted while waiting for the next result.
        ExecutionException - If an error occurred during computation.

      • next

        public V next(long timeout,
     TimeUnit unit)
       throws InterruptedException,
              ExecutionException,
              TimeoutException
        Description copied from interface: Queuture
        Returns the next result of the asynchronous computation, waiting up to a given timeout for it to become available.

        If there are no more results to be returned, this method returns null. Subsequent calls to this method after computation is complete will always return null.

        This method will block until the next result is available, or until the timeout has expired.

        Specified by:
        next in interface Queuture<V>
        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum time to wait.
        unit - The time unit of the timeout parameter.
        Returns:
        The next result of the asynchronous computation, or null if there are no more results.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the current thread is interrupted while waiting for the next result.
        ExecutionException - If an error occurred during computation.
        TimeoutException - If the next result could not be computed within the constraints of the given timeout.

      • done

        protected void done()
        Callback method invoked when this task transitions to a done state (whether normally or via cancellation).

        The default implementation does nothing. Subclasses may override this method to invoke completion callbacks or perform bookkeeping. Note that you can query status inside the implementation of this method to determine whether this task has been cancelled.

      • setException

        protected void setException(Throwable t)
        Causes this class to report an ExecutionException with the given Throwable as its cause, unless the computation has already completed or has been cancelled.

        This method is invoked internally by the run() method upon failure of the computation.

        Parameters:
        t - The cause of failure.

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
